page.title: 19GROYNES ON BOURNEMOUTH BEACH
page.content: ON SOUTHBOURNE BEACH THE COUNCIL ARE PUTTING IN NEW GROYNES TO STOP THE SEA COMING IN TOO HIGH AND FLOODING THE BEACH HUTS. THE SAND IS ALL PILED UP IN A HEAP BECAUSE THE CURRENT IS PULLING IT ALONG. WHEN THE WAVES COME IN THEY BRING MORE SAND WITH THEM SO IT PILES UP HIGH AND THE SEA CAN'T GET OVER THE TOP. WHEN THE WATER COMES THE SAND CRUMBLES AWAY BUT ON THE NEXT WAVE IT BRINGS ANOTHER LOT OF SAND. THE GROYNE STOPS THE SAND FROM BEING CARRIED AWAY. IF WE DIDN'T HAVE A GROYNE THE BEACH WOULD DISAPPEAR AND THE BEACH HUTS WOULD BE IN DANGER FROM THE SEA. THE CLIFFS AT SOUTHBOURNE ARE VERY SOFT AND CRUMBLY. DURING WINTER STORMS THEY SOMETIMES COLLAPSE AND DESTROY SOME OF THE BEACH HUTS.
